channel.title: Pages on Dr Tobias E. Naegele
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Dr Tobias E. Naegele

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: This portfolio provides a non-exhaustive list of selected recent project highlights. In places specific details may remain undisclosed until later publication in full in either publication or patent form. I am always happy to discuss with interested parties. Redox Flow Iontophoresis for Brain Cancer Therapy Illustration of the redox flow iontophoresis concept, Adv. Mater. Technol. 9, 2024 Drug delivery to the brain and spinal cord is limited by the blood-brain barrier, which is a major reason for the poor prognosis of brain tumours.

item.title: About me
item.description: I am an early career researcher specialising in innovative approaches to neural interfaces and brain cancer treatment, working at the interface of physics, engineering and neuroscience. I am currently a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Cambridge. My academic journey began in physics, which I later combined with expertise in neurotechnology and bioelectronics engineering. I relish the opportunity to work at the highly interdisciplinary interface of neurotechnology, engineering, physics, chemistry, and neurosurgery.
